data.subject: sci.space
data.body_choice:
Which mouse is the best is a very personal thing.

I also fell into the trap of getting a G502 just because I heard so much positive things about it but ended up hating it, because I couldn't get comfortable with it at all.

Ended up doing more research into what I really want from a mouse and ended up with the G600, which has a form I prefer, mostly due to the ring finger and pinky rest, as well as the additional buttons it provides for hotkeys.

That doesn't mean the G502 is bad or the G600 is good however. Try to figure out which form you prefer (claw/palm grip), how much it shoud weigh (some come with optional weights), what material you want, how many buttons you need and other features (wireless, RGB lighting and so on...) and then get that one.

data.subject: soc.religion.christian
data.body_choice:
I read a lot of the answers, and the overall thought is that the husband was a POS but not directly responisble for the teenagers suicide (we assume it truly was a suicide). I agree with this because the teenager who trusted your husband was let down and realized that there could possibly no people in this world who you can trust, even if you paid triple the amount for a minor incident. She obviously needed something/someone telling her that there are still good people in this world, despite her upbringing experiences. Your husband let her down. He wants OPs assurance because he knows he fucked up officially for all to see. I still think that it is the parents fault for the daughters suicide.  
BUT, why was it only the husband to handle this? They are married, living on a shared property. I think that the husband took it in his hands to handle that ( and the way he did it) says a lot about OPs living situation and the husband. Obviously he thinks that this is a "man-to-man" conversation when a minor (or female?) fucks up? Is he generally the head of the household? This is really disturbing from all angles. I sense some ongoing issues here, for which the teenage suicide is just the surface. OPs marital situation might play a role in her beeing disgusted by her partners actions, and this being a "valid" reason for her to disaprove of him. Because this time he fucked up the live of another person, not only hers.  
OP, if you feel like you could have been the victim or are relieved that only now you have a "valid" reason to be upset with your partner, please consider you can get away and do this alone. You don't need validation from strangers, trust your instinct. I know this is one of the hardest things and you might never do this. I am so sorry for the girl and you both. Good luck!
